If you're in the mood for some dark humor, I'd recommend giving "Hot Fuzz" a watch! It's a hilarious black comedy about an overzealous police officer who finds himself in a small village with a mysterious string of grisly murders. The film stars Simon Pegg and Nick Frost, known for their work in the "Cornetto Trilogy."

Another option is "Smokin' Aces," which follows a Las Vegas performer-turned-snitch who becomes a target after deciding to testify against the mob. This action-packed film features an all-star cast including Ben Affleck, Jeremy Piven, and Chris Pine. Enjoy!

I'd highly recommend "Kiss Kiss Bang Bang" for you! It's a fun black comedy that follows a New York thief who gets sent to Hollywood to train as a detective, but things take an unexpected turn when he finds himself entangled in a murder mystery alongside a struggling actress. Robert Downey Jr., who plays the lead character, delivers a fantastic performance in this film.

If you're interested in something with more of a darker tone, "Training Day" might be right up your alley. This crime drama follows a rookie cop and his unconventional training day with a seasoned but morally ambiguous detective played by Denzel Washington. It's a gripping story that won him an Oscar for Best Actor!

Both movies should meet your preference for a mix of excitement, warmth, and crime elements. Enjoy your movie time!

Both "Winter in Wartime" and "Training Day" are engaging choices!

"Winter in Wartime", set in German-occupied Netherlands, offers a gripping story of a teenage boy's involvement in the Dutch resistance. It features captivating performances by Yorick van Wageningen.

On the other hand, "Training Day" is an edge-of-your-seat drama that explores the complexities of a rookie cop and his mentor, played by Denzel Washington, in the gritty world of Los Angeles narcotics. It's directed by Antoine Fuqua, who also helmed "The Equalizer" series with Denzel.

Another captivating film that might interest you, although it's outside the year 1937, is "The Deer Hunter" (1978), which delves into the profound impact of the Vietnam War on a small Pennsylvania town and its residents. Starring Robert De Niro and Christopher Walken, this film provides an in-depth exploration of friendship and survival during tumultuous times. Enjoy the viewing!

It seems like you're interested in films with a historical context, so I'd highly recommend "Casablanca" (1942). This classic film features Humphrey Bogart and Claude Rains, and it's set during World War II in Morocco. The story revolves around a cynical American cafe owner who is faced with a moral dilemma involving his former lover and the Nazis.

If you're open to more recent war films, "Patton" (1970) starring George C. Scott might also appeal to you. This movie focuses on the World War II career of the controversial American general George S. Patton. Both these films are compelling and offer an engaging look at historical events. Enjoy your cinematic journey!
